table.name: Org_Medication
table.description: This table stores information about all the medicines that can be prescribed. If a medicine does not exist, the user has to create a record for it before using it in, say, the Person_Medication record.

column.name: med_id
column.descr: Unique System ID for any given row

column.name: org_id
column.descr: The organization who has defined this medication record. An org may use only those medications that it has defined

column.name: med_type_id
column.descr: What type of medicine is this? Broad classification

column.name: med_type
column.descr: The type of medicine, if 'Other' chosen above

column.name: med_name
column.descr: The exact name of the medicine. This is the commercial name

column.name: generic_name
column.descr: The generic name for this medicine

table.name: Patient_Indication
table.description: Allows an unlimited number of special circumstances to be listed for a person including various types of allergies, advance directives by doctor or patient, as well as any preventive care and adverse reactions to medication, etc.

column.name: system_id
column.descr: Unique System ID for any given row

column.name: person_id
column.descr: The actual person record for which identifier is being defined

column.name: indication_type_id
column.descr: The type of indication that this record is storing

column.name: indication_type
column.descr: The type of indication, if 'Other' chosen above

column.name: indication
column.descr: The actual indication corresponding to this patient and the indication type above

table.name: Patient_Medication
table.description: Stores patient medication information including past and current medications and prescriptions NOTE: This table needs review and possible normalization.

column.name: system_id
column.descr: Unique system ID for any given row

column.name: patient_id
column.descr: The ID of the person whose medication information this record is storing

column.name: record_type
column.descr: The type of information held in this record

column.name: med_id
column.descr: The name of the medication . This is a reference to another table. To use medications here, one must first add the medication into the Medicine table

column.name: prescriber_id
column.descr: Physician who prescribed the prescription

column.name: pharmacy_id
column.descr: Pharmacy who filled or will be filling the prescription

column.name: pharmacy_name
column.descr: The name of the pharmacy if it does not already exist in the system and this is a one time use

column.name: first_dose
column.descr: First dose instructions

column.name: dose
column.descr: Dosage of the medication

column.name: dose_units
column.descr: Units the dosage is measured in (mg, cc, etc...)

column.name: sale_units
column.descr: Units the quantity is measured in (mg, cc, etc...)

column.name: route
column.descr: Route or method the medication is taken through

column.name: frequency
column.descr: Frequency at which the medication should be taken

column.name: prn
column.descr: Take as needed for (pain, nausea, etc...)

column.name: start_date
column.descr: Medication start date

column.name: end_date
column.descr: Medication end date

column.name: ongoing
column.descr: True if this is an ongoing medication

column.name: duration
column.descr: How long should the medication be taken

column.name: duration_units
column.descr: Units the duration is measured in (weeks, months, etc...)

column.name: quantity
column.descr: How many units of the medication per refill

column.name: num_refills
column.descr: How many times can the get the medication refilled without another visit

column.name: allow_generic
column.descr: Allow the use of generic brand medications?

column.name: allow_substitutions
column.descr: Allow the use of substitution medications?

column.name: notes
column.descr: Notes which won't be printed in a prescription

column.name: sig
column.descr: Instructions which will be printed in a prescription

column.name: status
column.descr: Status of the medication relating to the person

column.name: label
column.descr: True if label should include drug name and strength

column.name: label_language
column.descr: The language label should be printed in for this prescription

column.name: signed
column.descr: True if a provider signature is on file

column.name: referral_id
column.descr: Unique Referral ID

column.name: patient_id
column.descr: Who is the patient that is being referred from one doctor to another?

column.name: referrer_id
column.descr: The physician that is requesting another doctor to take a look at the above patient

column.name: referee_id
column.descr: The physician that the patient above is being referred to

column.name: user_id
column.descr: Person who has created this referral or to whom this referral is transferred [[[NOTE: This field does not need to exist since it will be replaced with the process_session data anyway. Comments?]]]

column.name: request_date
column.descr: When was this patient referred to the referee doctor?

column.name: referral_urgency
column.descr: Referral Urgency

column.name: code
column.descr: Usually a CPT code or code for the service/product

column.name: speciality
column.descr: Speciality of referred Physician

column.name: referral_type_id
column.descr: Type of Referral

column.name: allowed_visits
column.descr: Number of Visits allowed

column.name: auth_number
column.descr: Authorization Number

column.name: comm_type_id
column.descr: Method of communication

column.name: completion_date
column.descr: Date Of Completion

column.name: referral_status_id
column.descr: Status of Referral

column.name: referral_status_date
column.descr: Status of Referral

column.name: referral_reason
column.descr: Short description for annotating the reason

column.name: comments
column.descr: Referral comments
